task.summary: Default task
TileMap, TileSet, TestMap, and ReadXML all new classes, not connected to main game
TileMap, TileSet, TestMap, and ReadXML all new classes, not connected to main game
TileMap, TileSet, TestMap, and ReadXML all new classes, not connected to main game
The Game is functional but the map on Start Game is not being drawn properly
The Game is functional but the map on Start Game is not being drawn properly
The Background Game Map is Fully Functional
Check out the new tile map!!!! On the new game screen choose the start your adventure option to see the map load!
Added the main character class with animation and movement!!!!! No collision detection yet.
For some reason I can't upload the images that I've added to the project but I'll try to figure it out.

I figured out the issue with the images. You have to add the any new file of your project to the repository officially before it can be committed and pushed. Intellij was automatically asking me if I wanted to add any new source code to the repository project, but I had to add all the other files (images, tmx files, ect.) using the tortoisegit tool before they can be commited and pushed.
As for this push, the game currently supports object collision between the map objects and the main character, as well as an initial spawn point. I'm still testing out ideas with spawn points and entrance/exit points for the maps.
I changed some class names to not overlap with common packages in java, as well as changing the tmx map to a relative path name instead of absolute. This code should be fuly functional.
The game now has two maps and supports transfer between maps. Yellow boxes that are being drawn represent the map entrance/exit points.
The Game now has a character selection screen, as well as being able to change from map to map.
Added the Battle State as well as a replacement image for one that didn't upload properly before
Added a Sound Manager and Sound Class. There is currently a menu scroller sound and background music for the menu selections and the in-game mode. A selection sound needs to be added.
Oops, I didn't add the sound files to the last push. This should make the game fully functional.
Oops, I didn't add the sound files to the last push. This should make the game fully functional.

You can interact with objects by pressing the space bar. Go ahead and try picking some berries or mushrooms!
Also, a map manager was added. This class along with the map data class is used to save changes to maps (like when you pick the berries).

Alright, you gotta check it out guys!
I added a cave as well as a chest in the second outdoor map. I'm starting to flesh out some more characterists of the main character class, like equipment and what not.
Added dialog boxes that appear when you can interact with an object.
Added a game menu. It is mostly empty but the framework is set up so that when more game information is developed it can easily be added to the game menu. PRESS ENTER TO ENTER THE GAME MENU.
Added a Timed Dialog Box.
Fixed a bug with the Timed Dialog Box.
New Areas Added
Added some map character movement and collision with the moving character.
Added some map character movement and collision with the moving character.
Added some map character movement and collision with the moving character.

Added a Map Utility Class which has one method, to sort map characters based on their y position. This is important as it allows the characters to be drawn in an order will lay them over top of one another in an appropriate fashion.
Character collision resolution between themselves has been added, as well as some bugs with being able to talk to multiple characters at once being fixed.
I cleaned up the resources/images folder a bit.
I cleaned up the resources/images folder a bit.
Added a new area and DialogBox interface.
Trying to make a stable framework for game events, getting dialog, and opening a vendor shop.
I changed the Game State Machine to be a Singleton class and changed the methods and variables to be static.
Added an options menu to the game menu screen. It doesn't do anything yet, but it could be where we place things like volume changes and such.
Added an options menu to the game menu screen. It doesn't do anything yet, but it could be where we place things like volume changes and such.
Added an options menu to the game menu screen. It doesn't do anything yet, but it could be where we place things like volume changes and such.
Added an options menu to the game menu screen. It doesn't do anything yet, but it could be where we place things like volume changes and such.
Added an options menu to the game menu screen. It doesn't do anything yet, but it could be where we place things like volume changes and such.
Added some new character sprites
Added a little to the character menu
Added to the status menu which currently shows your level, experience, stats, and skills
Added health and mana to the status menu

MESSAGE.value: I changed some class names to not overlap with common packages in java, as well as changing the tmx map to a relative path name instead of absolute. This code should be fuly functional.
The game now has two maps and supports transfer between maps. Yellow boxes that are being drawn represent the map entrance/exit points.
The Game now has a character selection screen, as well as being able to change from map to map.
Added the Battle State as well as a replacement image for one that didn't upload properly before
Added a Sound Manager and Sound Class. There is currently a menu scroller sound and background music for the menu selections and the in-game mode. A selection sound needs to be added.
Oops, I didn't add the sound files to the last push. This should make the game fully functional.

You can interact with objects by pressing the space bar. Go ahead and try picking some berries or mushrooms!
Also, a map manager was added. This class along with the map data class is used to save changes to maps (like when you pick the berries).

Alright, you gotta check it out guys!

Character collision resolution between themselves has been added, as well as some bugs with being able to talk to multiple characters at once being fixed.
